TopicTitle: Linux 1.2.2.1622 does not load at all

Articles.Content:
I'm on Linux: 

$ uname -a
Linux metric 4.8.0-41-generic #44-Ubuntu SMP Fri Mar 3 15:27:17 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

This behaviour occurs from both the 32- and 64-bit launchers. The game is stock, from Steam, with no modifications at all.

The game starts, some logs are generated, but the output is a black screen. Not even the loading screen appears. The program hangs like this until either terminated, or after a minute or two at which point it silently dies on its own.

Unity Log

Terminated

31 minutes ago, reinderien said:

crash_20170319164726_2.dmp[6854]: error: libcurl.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

crash_20170319164726_2.dmp[6854]: file ''/tmp/dumps/crash_20170319164726_2.dmp'', upload no: ''libcurl.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory''

Hi reinderien, I can only assume the distribution you are using does not have libcurl installed, you may need to install both the i386 and 64bit versions to get both versions of KSP to start.

Unity officially supports Ubuntu and SteamOS, which should have libcurl installed by default.

I know that 1.2.2.1622 works on Linux Mint 18.1 and Xubuntu 16.04 and 16.10, you may also want to ensure libxcursor is installed as it is required by the Unity engine and some recent distros are omitting it.

15 minutes ago, sal_vager said:

Hi reinderien, I can only assume the distribution you are using does not have libcurl installed, you may need to install both the i386 and 64bit versions to get both versions of KSP to start.

Unity officially supports Ubuntu and SteamOS, which should have libcurl installed by default.

I know that 1.2.2.1622 works on Linux Mint 18.1 and Xubuntu 16.04 and 16.10, you may also want to ensure libxcursor is installed as it is required by the Unity engine and some recent distros are omitting it.

I already had libcurl3 and libxcursor amd64 installed. I then installed these: 

$ sudo apt install libcurl3:i386
$ sudo apt install libxcursor1:i386

After installing the i386 versions, I have this: 

$ dpkg -l | grep -E 'curl|xcursor'
ii  curl                                                        7.50.1-1ubuntu1.1                        amd64        command line tool for transferring data with URL syntax
ii  libcurl3:amd64                                              7.50.1-1ubuntu1.1                        amd64        easy-to-use client-side URL transfer library (OpenSSL flavour)
ii  libcurl3:i386                                               7.50.1-1ubuntu1.1                        i386         easy-to-use client-side URL transfer library (OpenSSL flavour)
ii  libcurl3-gnutls:amd64                                       7.50.1-1ubuntu1.1                        amd64        easy-to-use client-side URL transfer library (GnuTLS flavour)
ii  libcurl4-openssl-dev:amd64                                  7.50.1-1ubuntu1.1                        amd64        development files and documentation for libcurl (OpenSSL flavour)
ii  libxcursor1:amd64                                           1:1.1.14-1                               amd64        X cursor management library
ii  libxcursor1:i386                                            1:1.1.14-1                               i386         X cursor management library

I was also deeply suspicious of the "fatal stalled cross-thread pipe". I don't trust the hard drive that this was installed on, so I swapped it out.

Now both problems seem to have dropped from the log and the game loads. My greatest thanks for the insightful and very prompt response!
